title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=ae6b7a10fa3272821e9904431dab0b993b36aae7
comments:
Mister Mummy movie is crap, do not watch.

Genelia has become aunty but still acts like college student.
I have started watching Trial by Fire. Finished about three episodes and it's pretty decent. I had no idea about the Uphaar Theatre tragedy so everything is new to me.
If anyone is into anime, I can't recommend Bocchi the rock enough. It's great.

I am watching a show called The Patient 
Watched 3 episodes and its really good 
Steve carrell's and Domhnall gleeson's role are so effective and its a perfect binge watch cause there are 10 episodes only with 20 minutes 
duration
I feel it's just ok. Could have been better. I know the event itself was horrific but It's made overly sad and sometimes looks a bit fake and lacks good editing.

been watching better call saul. Iâ€™m on S3 and i absolutely love it.

watched m3ghan, it was pretty typical movie.
On my watchlist already!

Watching Vidaathu Karuppu. Old (late 90s) but good one. It is a twisted story about faith, science and multiple personality disorder .
Watch it on youtube.
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLVNEvSiKsSruGI_f7GJgxAGsrFLDBuJHN
Violent Night is a good movie.
i found the movie funny and liked it. Dont lynch me now lol

Saw Broker today in theatres. Koreeda is good as always. A treat to watch on the big screen.Beautiful story, gorgeous cinematography. 10/10 would recommend to everyone.

Watching Mcmillions on Hotstar, very intriguing.

Just started The Legend of Vox Machina season 2, it's so good I wish they released all the episodes  at once, it's agonizing to wait for episodes.
BCS is a masterpiece. You're in for a treat!
Mukundan Unni Associates is a cool watch for people who like dark comedies.
I just watch THE LAST OF US and it's amazing ,i recommend it to all of you , excited for next episode tomorrow
Watched nanpakal nerathu mayakam . Such a soothing and refreshing one

Girl in the Basement (2021)

Based on the infamous true story of Elisabeth Fritzl, who was locked up and abused for 24 years (from 1984 to 2008) by her father Josef in Amstetten (Austria).

Good movie but not for the faint of heart mind you.

&#x200B;

Would also recommend watching The Night Manager (2021) starring Tom Hiddleton (Loki) before the hotstar remake comes out.

"Empire", a seasonal podcast with the first season about the British East India Company, their conquest of India, Freedom Struggle all the way till Independence. Hosted by historian William Dalrymple, probably the world authority on the East India Company and radio presenter Anita Anand.

Definitely check it out, getting Dalrymple's books and attending JLF is pretty much what got me into reading about Arts and Humanities.

Gannibal on Hotstar.

Japanese horror/thriller/mystery/suspense genres. Comfy immersive watch.
Movie "Room" with Brie Larsson is also similar to the girl in the basement. Phenomenal movie. Told through the perspective of a child, so less grim, but will move you to tears
Fauda season 4 ftw!
Should I watch The Last of Us?
Please do! Brilliant show

It's one of the best dark comedies I have ever seen from India. It's so funny and immersive, never lets you get bored. 

Any people knowledgeable of malayalam cinema, can you suggest really good recent movies to watch but I don't wanna go back more than 10 years.

depends on what you want to see

- Jaya Jaya Jaya Hey
- Pada
- Nayattu
- Rohrschach
- Puzhu
- Great Indian Kitchen
- Kuruthi
- Thallumaala

These are movies that I liked and they are from the last couple of years

You can check /r/MalayalamMovies
Share the link for watching Girl in the Basement (2021). If it's not allowed to do so in the comments, DM me.
Awesome anime. I can absolutely relate to the story.
Fuck emmy for snubbing saul
For me ending kinda sucked

Definitely it is an amazing show based on 2 episodes i have seen 
FYI- The showrunner craig mizan is the one who was also the showrunner of Chernobyl
